meddle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to deliberately try to influence or change a situation that does not concern you, or that you do not understand
meddle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He accused the US of meddling in China’s internal affairs.
I don’t like other people meddling in the way I run this prison.
I’m not the sort of newspaper owner who meddles with editorial policy.
meddle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to touch something which you should not touch, especially in a careless way that might break it
meddle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: You have no right to come in here meddling with my things.
